title: Carbohydrate Metabolism & Glucose Regulation
body:
Glucose Homeostasis

Glucose regulation is key for diagnosing diabetes mellitus. Blood sugar levels are maintained by insulin and glucagon. Key tests: FBS, RBS, OGTT, HbA1c.

title: Liver Function Tests (LFTs)
body:
Liver Function Tests Overview

LFTs evaluate hepatocellular injury and cholestasis. Important markers include ALT, AST, ALP, bilirubin, and albumin. Patterns of enzyme elevation help diagnose the type of liver disease.

title: Renal Function Tests & Electrolytes
body:
Renal Function Tests

Tests include BUN, creatinine, eGFR, and electrolytes (Na⁺, K⁺, Cl⁻). Helps differentiate prerenal, renal, and postrenal causes. Visualize electrolyte changes and acid-base disturbances.
